title: Iiro Pakarinen
text:
Iiro Pakarinen (born 25 August 1991) is a Finnish professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> player for <a href="Jokerit">Jokerit</a> of the <a href="Kontinental%20Hockey%20League">Kontinental Hockey League</a> (KHL). Pakarinen previously played in the Finnish <a href="Liiga">Liiga</a> with <a href="KalPa">KalPa</a> and <a href="HIFK">HIFK</a>, and the <a href="National%20Hockey%20League">National Hockey League</a> (NHL) with the <a href="Edmonton%20Oilers">Edmonton Oilers</a>.
Playing career.
Pakarinen played in his native Finland from his youth level with professional Liiga club, <a href="KalPa">KalPa</a>. As a skilled versatile forward, Pakarinen was drafted 184th overall in the <a href="2011%20NHL%20Entry%20Draft">2011 NHL Entry Draft</a> by the <a href="Florida%20Panthers">Florida Panthers</a>. Unable to agree to terms with the Panthers, Pakarinen opted to continue his development in the Finnish Liiga with KalPa. On 3 May 2012, he joined <a href="HIFK%20%28ice%20hockey%29">HIFK</a> as a free agent on a two-year contract.
Upon completion of his second season with HIFK in <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Liiga%20season">2013–14</a> and scoring a career high 20 goals and 30 points, Pakarinen signed his first NHL contract as a free agent with the Edmonton Oilers on a two-year entry level deal on 16 June 2014. On 1 December 2017, he was placed on waivers by the Oilers, and was then sent to their AHL affiliate, the <a href="Bakersfield%20Condors">Bakersfield Condors</a>, on 2 December.
On 2 July 2018, Pakarinen left the Oilers and the NHL as a free agent, signing a one-year contract with Russian club, <a href="Metallurg%20Magnitogorsk">Metallurg Magnitogorsk</a> of the KHL. In the <a href="2018-19%20KHL%20season">2018–19 season</a>, Pakarinen made as positive impact with Metallurg, producing 19 goals and 26 points in 60 games.
On 2 May 2019, having concluded his contract with Metallurg, Pakarinen continued in the KHL signing a one-year deal with Kazakh-based, <a href="Barys%20Nur-Sultan">Barys Nur-Sultan</a>. In the following <a href="2019-20%20KHL%20season">2019–20 season</a>, Pakarinen suffered an injury-hit year, featuring in just 22 games and registering 10 points. He collected 1 goal in 5 post-season games before the playoffs were cancelled due to <a href="COVID-19">COVID-19</a>.
On 11 May 2020, Pakarinen opted to return to Finland and remain in the KHL, signing a three-year contract with Jokerit.
